issue.title: Development
issue.body:
fixed the amazon number issue (probably) 
needs testing on an actual alexa hopefully

issue.title: Get Alexa to stay in anime list mode
issue.body:
Every time the user want to use the function they must say the phrase "tell anime list..."
Instead of that we were trying to figure out how to make Alexa staying in that mode after just one Invocation name mention
For example: we access it with "tell anime list to find {anime}" and if we don't say "tell anime list to stop", all we need to do with the next action will just be "add {anime} to list" instead of "tell anime list to add {anime} to list"

issue.title: Anime Titles are being interpreted as AMAZON.NUMBER type
issue.body: For anime titles such as "One Piece" or "One Punch Man", the voice interface will interpret the word "One" as the number literal "1". This makes it so that MAL is unable to find these anime.

issue.title: Anime Titles are being interpreted as AMAZON.NUMBER type
issue.body: For anime titles such as "One Piece" or "One Punch Man", the voice interface will interpret the word "One" as the number literal "1". This makes it so that MAL is unable to find these anime.

issue.title: Login information must be gathered and secured
fuzzy searching/training is incomplete
issue.body: little japanese support, and also some anime not in training data is unrecognizable

issue.title: Get Alexa to stay in anime list mode
issue.body:
Every time the user want to use the function they must say the phrase "tell anime list..."
Instead of that we were trying to figure out how to make Alexa staying in that mode after just one Invocation name mention
For example: we access it with "tell anime list to find {anime}" and if we don't say "tell anime list to stop", all we need to do with the next action will just be "add {anime} to list" instead of "tell anime list to add {anime} to list"

issue.title: Anime Titles are being interpreted as AMAZON.NUMBER type
issue.body: For anime titles such as "One Piece" or "One Punch Man", the voice interface will interpret the word "One" as the number literal "1". This makes it so that MAL is unable to find these anime.
